intro: Allantodia squamigera, commonly known as the squamose allantodia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are covered in fine, scale-like structures, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Allantodia squamigera is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley.
